00002 // ENCODER FUNCTIONS AND DEFINES
00003 // *****************************
00004 #ifndef ENCODER_H
00005 #define ENCODER_H
00006 
00007 //*****************************************************************************
00008 //
00009 // IF building with a C++ compiler, make all of the definitions in this header
00010 // have a C binding.
00011 //
00012 //*****************************************************************************
00013 #ifdef __cplusplus
00014 extern "C"
00015 {
00016 #endif
00017 
00018 typedef enum { ENCODER_0, ENCODER_1 } encoder_t;        // encoder data type
00019 typedef signed long encoder_count_t;                            // encoder count type
00020 
00021 // Summary:     Initializes the appropriate interrupts for encoders
00022 // Note:        Always call this function before any other encoder-related functions
00023 extern void InitializeEncoders(tBoolean invert0, tBoolean invert1);
00024 
00025 // Summary:     Override the current encoder count(s) with the provided count(s)
00026 extern void PresetEncoderCounts(encoder_count_t new_count0, encoder_count_t new_count1);
00027 extern void PresetEncoderCount(encoder_t encoder, encoder_count_t new_count);
00028 
00029 // Summary: Retrieve the current enconder count(s)
00030 extern void GetEncoderCounts(encoder_count_t *pEncCount0, encoder_count_t *pEncCount1);
00031 extern encoder_count_t GetEncoderCount(encoder_t encoder);
00032 
00033 //*****************************************************************************

00036 //
00037 //*****************************************************************************

00039 }
00040 #endif
00041 
00042 #endif // ENCODER_H
